title: The Whistleblower Affair, A Banking Director's Skulduggery Exposed
description: This is an exposure of corrupt banking practices by an employee 'the whistleblower'. As the book unfolds you are given an insight into how a bank director behaves towards customers,staff and other directors in his attempt to climb the corporate ladder, increase his already huge salary and protect unwarranted bonuses at any cost to those around him. Despicable behavior that deserves to be exposed, but can the whistleblower convince his employers and the press if necessary of these wrongdoings, especially when the director turns his attention towards trying to discredit him and everything he says?
author: Jonathan Veale
